summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, directing the prosecution and defense to submit a joint estimate of when jury deliberations are likely to begin, to assist with trial logistics and scheduling around the Christmas holiday.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the court order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued the scheduling order.

events.title: Jury Selection Completion
events.description: The date by which jury selection is expected to be complete.

events.title: Opening Statements
events.description: The scheduled date for opening statements in the trial.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: The court is actively planning logistics for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.
Jury selection is scheduled to be complete by November 19, 2021, with opening statements on November 29, 2021.
The court is considering the possibility of the trial continuing after the Christmas holiday and may require the jury to sit during the week between Christmas and New Year's Day.
The prosecution and defense are ordered to confer and submit a joint letter by October 12, 2021, estimating when jury deliberations are likely to begin.
